result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan S Robarge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit 15 days granted if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2

miscConds.notes:
Maintain full-time employment that does not involve driving.  Defendant not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

timeConds.notes: Non-Working Hours with Standard Release Conditions-STAYED for use by Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan S Robarge

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Bryan S Robarge in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 3 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
- 5 months Huber with standard release conditions CONCURRENT with Count 2. STAYED.  Credit for 15 days if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Maintain full-time employment that does not involve driving.  Defendant not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid license.

Count 2:
- 5 months Huber with standard release conditions CONCURRENT with Count 1. STAYED.  Credit for 15 days if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.
CONDITION TIME: 30 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for use by Agent.

Defendant Bryan S Robarge in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has received complaint and offer but is awaiting discovery.  Defendant has other matters pending in Milwaukee County.  Hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Bryan S Robarge in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
